dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, Kazhydromet is calling for a pretty wild few days across Kazakhstan starting June 3rd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, Kazhydromet is calling for a pretty wild few days across Kazakhstan starting June third.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forecasters at Kazhydromet have shared the weather outlook for Kazakhstan on June 3, 4, and 5.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, they're talking about a northwestern cyclone moving through, which means, uh, rain and thunderstorms for most places.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, they're talking about a northwestern cyclone moving through, which means, uh, rain and thunderstorms for most places.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a northwestern cyclone and associated atmospheric fronts pass through, most of the country will face unstable weather. Rain and thunderstorms are expected, along with gusty winds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And not just a little rain—like, heavy downpours and even hail up in the north and northwest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And not just a little rain-like, heavy downpours and even hail up in the north and northwest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Heavy rain is forecast during the daytime in northern and northwestern regions, with a chance of hail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, the southwest gets dust storms. It's like the weather can't make up its mind!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, the southwest gets dust storms. It's like the weather can't make up its mind!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dust storms are expected in the southwest, south, and southeast.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the temperature swings are all over the place. The north is actually cooling down a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the temperature swings are all over the place. The north is actually cooling down a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the north, nighttime temperatures will dip slightly from 10-17ÂC to 8-15ÂC, and daytime highs will decrease from 25-30ÂC to 18-23ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, daytime highs dropping from like 30 to 23 Celsius? That's a noticeable shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, daytime highs dropping from like thirty to twenty three Celsius? That's a noticeable shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the north, nighttime temperatures will dip slightly from 10-17ÂC to 8-15ÂC, and daytime highs will decrease from 25-30ÂC to 18-23ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then the east and southeast are warming up—daytime temps climbing into the mid-30s.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then the east and southeast are warming up-daytime temps climbing into the mid-30s.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Eastern Kazakhstan will see a slight warming trend, with nighttime temperatures rising from 7-18ÂC to 9-20ÂC and daytime temperatures increasing from 22-33ÂC to 24-35ÂC. A similar trend is expected in the southeast, where nighttime temperatures will rise from 5-15ÂC to 7-17ÂC, and daytime highs will climb from 22-30ÂC to 25-35ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the south is just… I mean, 40 to 42 degrees? That's extreme heat warning territory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the south is just... I mean, forty to forty two degrees? That's extreme heat warning territory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the southern regions, residents should brace for extreme heat, with temperatures potentially reaching 40-42ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And this is just the start of summer! The Minister, Yerlan Nyssanbayev, already warned about potential 45C in the southwest later.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is just the start of summer! The Minister, Yerlan Nyssanbayev, already warned about potential forty five degrees c in the southwest later.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Minister of Ecology and Natural Resources Yerlan Nyssanbayev shared the weather forecast for the upcoming summer in Kazakhstan. In some parts of the southwest, temperatures could reach 45ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so this might be a taste of what's coming. Though he said it should be near normal for rain in June and July?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so this might be a taste of what's coming. Though he said it should be near normal for rain in June and July?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rainfall in June and July is expected to be within normal levels, though the north, south, and southeast may receive slightly more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mostly, yeah, but maybe a bit more in the north and south. Then August and September could be drier and hotter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mostly, yeah, but maybe a bit more in the north and south. Then August and September could be drier and hotter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rainfall in June and July is expected to be within normal levels, though the north, south, and southeast may receive slightly more. In August and September, less rainfall is expected, and temperatures may be about 1ÂC above normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So basically, pack an umbrella and sunscreen, depending on where you are. It's a real mixed bag.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So basically, pack an umbrella and sunscreen, depending on where you are. It's a real mixed bag.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Always good to keep an eye on those updates though, since they say it's still preliminary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Always good to keep an eye on those updates though, since they say it's still preliminary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This forecast is preliminary and subject to change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Weather's full of surprises.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Weather's full of surprises.
